pages.text: A variety of fuel sources exist in the world to power pre-electrical machinery.

Biomass is a fuel source derived from plant matter. Crops and leaves can be crushed by a $(l:tools/hammers)Hammer$() or $(l:machines/piston_crusher)Piston Crusher$() to yield biomass. Biomass has a fuel value of 50.
Crafting biomass into a condensed form makes it a more suitable fuel. Compressed Biomass has a fuel value of 200.

Charcoal is a concentrated carbon source derived from partially oxided organic matter. The traditional way of smelting logs can be disabled/enabled in the config. The new process for creating charcoal is outlined in the  $(mechanics/charcoal)Charcoal Creation$(). Additionally, compressed biomass can be cooked in a blast furnace to yield charcoal.. Charcoal has a fuel value of 800.
One of the coal ores found in world. Can be used to craft 3 torches. Lignite has a fuel value of 1200.
One of the coal ores found in world. Can be used to craft 4 torches. Subituminous Coal has a fuel value of 1600.
One of the coal ores found in world. Can be used to craft 6 torches. Bituminous Coal has a fuel value of 2400.
One of the coal ores found in world (Nether by default). Can be used to craft 8 torches. Anthracite Coal has a fuel value of 3200.

Coke is a refined carbon source with low sulfur content compared to coals. It is made by cooking Blocks of Subbituminous or Bituminous Coal on the $(l:machines/beehive_oven)Beehive Oven$(). Can be used to craft 16 torches with a Cast Iron rod. Coke has a fuel value of 3200.
